description: Numbers n such that n and n + 10 are both prime.
comments: A subset of A002476. It appears that this is also a subset of A007645. The first few terms of A007645 that are not in this sequence are {67, 109, 151, 193, 199, 211, 277, 313, 331, 367, 397, 463, 487, 523, 541, 571, 601, 613,...}. - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Aug 15 2006The entries are all in A007645, because they cannot be of the form p = 3*k + 2. If they were, p + 10 = 3*k + 12 would be divisible by 3 and not prime. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 30 2009
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Twin Primes
prog: (MAGMA) [n: n in [0..1000] | IsPrime(n) and IsPrime(n+10)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 20 2010(PARI) is(n)=isprime(n)&&isprime(n+10) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 01 2013
crossrefs: Different from A015916. Cf. A031928, A079033.
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: Revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 29 2013
